owncloud_list_files.notes: path must start with /; defaults to root directory

owncloud_get_file_info.notes: Full path to file or folder; returns metadata like size, modified date

owncloud_upload_file.notes: local_path is absolute or relative local file path; remote_path starts with /

owncloud_download_file.notes: Downloads file from OwnCloud to local system

owncloud_create_folder.notes: Creates nested folders automatically if they do not exist

owncloud_delete_file.notes: Permanently deletes file or folder; use with caution

owncloud_search_files.notes: Searches file and folder names; supports wildcards like *.pdf

owncloud_get_storage_info.notes: Returns storage quota, used space, and available space; no parameters needed

plane_get_user.notes: Returns current user information including username, email, quota; no parameters needed

plane_get_workspace_members.notes: Returns all members of the current workspace; no parameters needed

plane_get_projects.notes: Returns all projects accessible to current user; no parameters needed

plane_create_project.notes: Creates new project in workspace; returns project UUID

plane_list_issue_types.notes: project_id is UUID format; returns all issue types like Bug, Feature, Task

plane_get_issue_type.notes: Both IDs are UUIDs; returns details of specific issue type

plane_create_issue_type.notes: Creates custom issue type for project

plane_update_issue_type.notes: issue_type_data must be JSON string with fields to update

plane_delete_issue_type.notes: Permanently deletes issue type; cannot be undone

plane_list_states.notes: Returns all workflow states like Todo, In Progress, Done

plane_get_state.notes: Both IDs are UUIDs; returns state details including color and group

plane_create_state.notes: color in hex format (#RRGGBB); common colors: red, orange, yellow, green, blue

plane_update_state.notes: state_data is JSON string; can update name, color, description, sequence

plane_delete_state.notes: Issues in this state should be moved before deletion

plane_list_labels.notes: Returns all labels/tags for project organization

plane_get_label.notes: Returns label details including color and associated issues count

plane_create_label.notes: color in hex format; labels are used for categorizing issues

plane_update_label.notes: label_data is JSON string with fields to update

plane_delete_label.notes: Removes label from all associated issues

plane_get_issue_using_readable_identifie.notes: Use format PROJ-123 where PROJ is project identifier and 123 is issue number

plane_get_issue_comments.notes: Returns all comments with author, timestamp, and HTML content

plane_add_issue_comment.notes: comment_html accepts HTML markup; supports links to other issues

plane_create_issue.notes: Creates issue directly in a cycle/sprint; bypasses backlog

plane_create_cycle_issue.notes: Modules are feature groups or project components

plane_update_issue.notes: Returns module details including progress, issue count, dates

plane_delete_issue.notes: Modules help organize issues by feature or component

plane_list_modules.notes: module_data is JSON string with fields to update

plane_get_module.notes: Issues remain in project but are unlinked from module

plane_create_module.notes: Returns all issues associated with the module

plane_update_module.notes: issues parameter is JSON string array of issue UUIDs

plane_delete_module.notes: Removes issue from module but does not delete the issue

plane_list_module_issues.notes: Cycles are sprints or time-boxed iterations

plane_add_module_issues.notes: Returns cycle details including dates, progress, issue counts

plane_delete_module_issue.notes: Dates in YYYY-MM-DD format; typical sprints are 1-4 weeks

plane_list_cycles.notes: cycle_data is JSON string; can update name, dates, status

plane_get_cycle.notes: Issues are moved back to backlog; cycle data is permanently deleted

plane_create_cycle.notes: Moves all incomplete issues from one cycle to another

plane_update_cycle.notes: Returns all issues in the cycle with full details

plane_delete_cycle.notes: issues is JSON string array; moves existing issues into cycle

plane_transfer_cycle_issues.notes: Removes issue from cycle; issue remains in project backlog

plane_list_cycle_issues.notes: Returns all time entries logged for the issue

plane_add_cycle_issues.notes: Returns total time logged across all project issues

plane_get_issue_worklogs.notes: worklog_data is JSON string; can update duration and description

plane_get_total_worklogs.notes: Permanently removes time entry from issue

plane_create_worklog.notes: All parameters optional; sortfield can be: name, date_creation, code_client

plane_update_worklog.notes: id is integer company/third-party ID from database

plane_delete_worklog.notes: Only name required; country_code uses ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 (US, GB, FR, DE, etc.)

dolibarr_get_companies.notes: status can be: draft, validated, paid, unpaid, canceled, abandoned

dolibarr_get_company.notes: id is integer invoice ID; returns full invoice with line items

dolibarr_create_company.notes: date format YYYY-MM-DD; ref is invoice reference number; date defaults to today

dolibarr_get_invoices.notes: type can be: product, service; returns both if type is null

dolibarr_get_invoice.notes: id is integer product/service ID; returns details including price, stock

dolibarr_create_invoice.notes: type: 0=physical product, 1=service; price is float in base currency

dolibarr_get_products.notes: Returns all employees/users; includes active and inactive

dolibarr_get_product.notes: admin: 0=regular user, 1=administrator; password must meet security requirements

dolibarr_create_product.notes: status can be: approved, pending, refused, canceled; null returns all

dolibarr_get_projects.notes: Dates YYYY-MM-DD; halfday: 0=full day, 1=morning only, 2=afternoon only; type: vacation, sick, rtt

dolibarr_get_users.notes: fk_user=null for all users; month 1-12; year is integer; returns time tracking data

examples.message: Hello John! Can you review the PR?
Team meeting at 3 PM in conference room

dolibarr_get_user.notes: Use @first.last for direct messages to users in lowercase, #channel-name for public/private channels

dolibarr_create_user.notes: Returns list of all channels user has access to; no parameters needed

dolibarr_get_holidays.notes: Channel name must start with #; count defaults to 20; returns recent messages

dolibarr_create_holiday_request.notes: Channel names lowercase with hyphens; private=true for private channels

dolibarr_get_timesheets.notes: Returns current authenticated user information; no parameters needed

rocktchat_send_message.notes: Returns Rocket.Chat server version and configuration info; no parameters

rocktchat_get_channels.notes: room_id optional; searches across all accessible rooms if null

rocktchat_get_channel_messages.notes: Returns list of all direct message conversations; no parameters needed

rocktchat_create_channel.notes: Must include # prefix; only works for public channels

rocktchat_get_user_info.notes: Must include # prefix; leaves the specified channel

rocktchat_get_server_info.notes: project_id can be numeric ID or URL-encoded path; merge_request_iid is the internal ID (not global ID); use squash=true to combine commits

examples.query: mutation($projectId: ProjectID!, $title: String!) { createIssue(input: {projectPath: $projectId, title: $title}) { issue { iid title } } }

rocktchat_search_messages.notes: Powerful GraphQL API for complex queries; variables must be JSON object; use for advanced queries not covered by REST API

examples.content:
# My Project

This is my project documentation.

rocktchat_get_direct_messages.notes: Creates file if it doesn't exist, updates if it does; previous_path for moving/renaming files; automatically creates directories in path

rocktchat_get_users.notes: Searches across all accessible Rocket Chat Users; supports partial name matching; Show all the users, don't restrict based on page or per_page

rocktchat_join_channel.notes: visibility: private (members only), internal (logged-in users), public (everyone); initialize_with_readme creates default README.md

gitlab_merge_merge_request.notes: Returns file content or directory listing; ref can be branch, tag, or commit SHA; file_path can be file or directory

gitlab_execute_graphql.notes: Atomic operation: all files committed together; creates branch if it doesn't exist; files is array of {file_path, content} objects

examples.title: Fix login bug
examples.description: Users unable to login with SSO credentials

examples.title: Add dark mode support
examples.description:
## Requirements
- Toggle switch in settings
- Persist preference
- Apply to all pages

examples.title: Test API endpoints
examples.description: Verify all REST API endpoints return correct status codes

gitlab_create_or_update_file.notes: Arguments: [project_id; title: title or name of the issue; issue_type: issue (default), incident, test_case, task; assignee_ids are user IDs (numbers); labels are strings; description supports Markdown]

examples.title: Feature: Add user authentication
examples.description:
## Changes
- JWT token authentication
- Login/logout endpoints
- Password hashing

examples.title: WIP: Refactor database queries
examples.description: Work in progress - optimizing slow queries

gitlab_search_repositories.notes: draft=true creates WIP/Draft MR; squash=true combines commits on merge; remove_source_branch=true deletes branch after merge; assignee_ids vs reviewer_ids

gitlab_create_repository.notes: Forks to your personal namespace by default; namespace parameter to fork to specific group/subgroup; full path required for namespace

gitlab_get_file_contents.notes: ref is source branch, tag, or commit SHA; branch is new branch name; creates from specified ref point

gitlab_push_files.notes: Provide either merge_request_iid OR source_branch; returns full MR details including approvals, conflicts, pipeline status

gitlab_create_issue.notes: view: 'inline' (default) or 'parallel' for side-by-side diff view; returns unified diff format

gitlab_create_merge_request.notes: Paginated diff listing; unidiff=true for unified diff format (GitLab 16.5+); useful for large MRs with many file changes

gitlab_fork_repository.notes: straight=false uses three-dot diff (...), straight=true uses two-dot (--); excluded_file_patterns uses JavaScript regex; from/to can be branches, tags, or commit SHAs

gitlab_create_branch.notes: state_event: 'close' or 'reopen'; draft=true/false toggles WIP status; can update assignees, reviewers, labels independently

examples.body: This issue is related to #123 and needs attention

gitlab_get_merge_request.notes: noteable_type: 'issue' or 'merge_request'; noteable_iid is internal ID; body supports Markdown and emoji

examples.body: Consider refactoring this function for better readability

gitlab_get_merge_request_diffs.notes: CRITICAL: Get base_sha, head_sha, start_sha from MR diff_refs; line_code format: {hash}_{old_line}_{new_line}; position_type: 'text' for code, 'image' for images, 'file' for file-level

gitlab_list_merge_request_diffs.notes: Returns all discussion threads with notes; includes resolved/unresolved status; paginated for large MRs

examples.body: Updated comment: Fixed in latest commit
Reopening discussion - issue not fully resolved

gitlab_get_branch_diffs.notes: Requires both discussion_id and note_id; resolved=true marks thread as resolved; only author or maintainers can edit

gitlab_update_merge_request.notes: Adds reply to existing discussion thread; created_at optional (ISO 8601 format); body supports Markdown

gitlab_create_note.notes: Retrieves single draft note; drafts are visible only to author until published

gitlab_create_merge_request_thread.notes: Returns all draft notes for MR; drafts are private until published; useful for batching review comments

examples.body: General comment about the PR approach

gitlab_mr_discussions.notes: Creates draft comment (not published immediately); position optional for line-specific comments; resolve_discussion for publishing drafts that resolve threads

gitlab_update_merge_request_note.notes: Updates existing draft note; can change body, position, and resolve_discussion setting before publishing

gitlab_create_merge_request_note.notes: Permanently deletes draft note; cannot be undone; only affects unpublished drafts

gitlab_get_draft_note.notes: Publishes single draft note; makes it visible to all MR participants; converts to regular note

gitlab_list_draft_notes.notes: Publishes ALL draft notes for the MR at once; useful for batch review; atomic operation

examples.body: Updated: This was fixed in v2.0.1

gitlab_create_draft_note.notes: Updates existing issue comment; requires both discussion_id and note_id; only author or maintainers can edit

examples.body: I can help with this issue

gitlab_update_draft_note.notes: Adds reply to existing issue discussion; created_at optional; body supports Markdown and issue references

gitlab_delete_draft_note.notes: scope: 'created_by_me' (default), 'assigned_to_me', 'all'; assignee_id accepts user ID, 'none', or 'any'; dates in ISO 8601 format; issue_type: issue, incident, test_case, task

gitlab_publish_draft_note.notes: Returns issues assigned to authenticated user; state defaults to 'opened'; shorthand for list_issues with assignee filter

gitlab_bulk_publish_draft_notes.notes: issue_iid is internal project issue ID (not global ID); returns full issue details including comments count, time stats, related MRs

gitlab_update_issue_note.notes: issue_type REQUIRED; state_event: 'close' or 'reopen'; weight 0-9 for issue sizing; due_date in YYYY-MM-DD format

gitlab_create_issue_note.notes: Permanently deletes issue; cannot be undone; requires maintainer/owner permissions

gitlab_list_issues.notes: Returns all linked issues; link types: relates_to, blocks, is_blocked_by

gitlab_my_issues.notes: Returns all discussion threads on issue; includes notes, system notes, timestamps; paginated

gitlab_get_issue.notes: Gets specific issue link relationship; returns source, target, link_type

gitlab_update_issue.notes: link_type: 'relates_to' (default), 'blocks', 'is_blocked_by'; can link across projects; creates bidirectional relationship

gitlab_delete_issue.notes: Removes issue link relationship; does not delete issues themselves

gitlab_list_issue_links.notes: Namespaces are users and groups; owned=true filters to your namespaces; search matches name/path

gitlab_list_issue_discussions.notes: namespace_id can be numeric ID or full path; returns namespace type (user/group), visibility, member count

gitlab_get_issue_link.notes: Checks if namespace path is available; useful before creating projects/groups; returns exists: true/false

gitlab_create_issue_link.notes: Returns full project details: visibility, default_branch, statistics, permissions, settings

gitlab_delete_issue_link.notes: order_by: id, name, path, created_at, updated_at, last_activity_at; min_access_level: 10=Guest, 20=Reporter, 30=Developer, 40=Maintainer, 50=Owner

gitlab_list_namespaces.notes: query searches name and username; user_ids filters specific users; skip_users excludes users; returns access level and role

gitlab_get_namespace.notes: include_subgroups traverses group hierarchy; with_programming_language filters by language; starred filters user-starred projects

gitlab_verify_namespace.notes: path='' for root directory; recursive=true for nested directories; returns type (tree/blob), name, path, mode for each entry

gitlab_get_project.notes: state: opened, closed, locked, merged, all; wip: yes/no for draft MRs; scope: created_by_me, assigned_to_me, all; assignee/reviewer accepts ID or username

gitlab_list_projects.notes: ref_name: branch, tag, or range (e.g., 'main..development'); since/until in ISO 8601; path filters commits affecting specific file/directory; with_stats adds insertions/deletions; order: default or topo (topological)

gitlab_list_project_members.notes: sha can be commit SHA, branch name, or tag; stats=true includes file change statistics; returns full commit details, author, message, parent commits

gitlab_list_labels.notes: full_diff=true returns complete diff (may be large); full_diff=false returns first page only; shows file changes with context

gitlab_get_label.notes: state: opened, upcoming, current, closed, all; iterations are time-boxed periods for planning; include_ancestors/descendants traverse group hierarchy

gitlab_create_label.notes: Uploads file for use in Markdown (issues, MRs, comments); returns Markdown link format; file stored in project uploads directory

gitlab_update_label.notes: secret is 32-character upload ID from Markdown link; filename must match original; local_path optional (defaults to current directory)

gitlab_delete_label.notes: Returns activity feed for current user; target_type: epic, issue, merge_request, milestone, note, project, snippet, user; dates in YYYY-MM-DD format; before/after are exclusive

gitlab_list_group_projects.notes: Returns activity feed for specific project; similar to list_events but project-scoped; visible events only (respects permissions)
